result.execSummary:
The defendant Chase M. MICKEY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement is ordered under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence and if, within the next 12 months, the defendant has no criminal or ordinance drug arrests/contacts with law enforcement.  The Court finds that the defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment in this matter.
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chase M. MICKEY

defendant.name: MICKEY, Chase M.
defendant.address: 9 E. Redwood Street, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Collected on 03-20-19 in case no:  18 CF 88.
records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder notice, DNA relay form and copy of JOC mailed to Attorney Michael Chernin.

Neither the defendant nor Attorney Chernin are present today.  Attorney has filed an authorization to appear by phone on the defendant's behalf.
GUILTY plea entered to count 2, possess THC.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, possess drug paraphernalia.  Motion granted.
The Court comments and imposes a $100.00 fine plus costs, total of $673.50.  $200.00 cash bail applied.  $473.50 balance is to be paid by 11-13-16 or 9 days county jail for failure to pay.
The court orders the defendant to submit to a DNA sample.
Expungement is ordered under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence and if, within the next 12 months, the defendant has no criminal or ordinance drug arrests/contacts with law enforcement.  The Court finds that the defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment in this matter.
